intro: Verbesina pauciflora, commonly known as the few-flowered beggar-tick, is a herbaceous plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads and opposite leaf arrangement. The plant features yellow-orange flowers that bloom in late summer, and its stems are covered in fine, sticky hairs. Its leaves are lance-shaped with serrated edges and are often covered in a similar waxy coating. Verbesina pauciflora is typically found in moist, open habitats such as wetlands and along stream banks.
